required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: KN035 in Combination With Trastuzumab and Docetaxel in HER2-positive Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: KN035, a Single Domain PD-L1 Subcutanuous Injection Antibody, in Combination With Trastuzumab and Docetaxel in HER2-positive Breast Cancer

lead_sponsor.agency: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single arm phase II trial to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel. Eligible patient will be enrolled and receive protocol defined therapies until progressive disease, unacceptable toxicity or withdrawal of informed consent. Tumor assessment will be performed according to RECIST 1.1 criteria.

primary_outcome.description: To estimate the overall response rate (CR + PR) of KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel in patients with recurrent or metastatic HER2-positive breast cancer. • Overall Response rate will include confirmed complete response (CR) + confirmed partial response (PR), as determined as per RECIST v1.1 criteria and assessed by the local investigator

secondary_outcome.description: To characterize the toxicity of KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel as defined by the NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE)

other_outcome.description: To estimate the disease control rate (CR + PR + SD) of KN046 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel. Disease control rate will include complete response (CR], partial response (PR), and stable disease (SD), as per RECIST v1.1 criteria

arm_group.arm_group_label: KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel

intervention.arm_group_label: KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel

intervention.description: 8 mg/kg IV loading followed by 6 mg/kg Q3W IV
intervention.arm_group_label: KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel
KN035 in combination with trastuzumab and docetaxel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Written informed consent
- Female subjects with age 18 to 70 (inclusive) years at the time of consent
- LVEF ≥50% at baseline
- ECOG performance status of 0-1
- Have not received 1L treatment for recurrent or metastatic breast cancer
- Adequate organ function
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of exposure to the cumulative doses of doxorubicin > 400 mg / m2 or equivalent
- History of autoimmune diseases
- Active brain metastasis
- Concurrent diseases that compromise patient's safety

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Sun Yat-Sen Memorial Hospital of Sun Yat-Sen University
